snippet: Globally, more children than ever are attending school, but some experts say high-quality education has proved elusive. The solution will be expensive.
abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column warns that while, worldwide, far more people attend school than even a quarter-century ago, improvement is belied by abysmally low educational standards across globe; observes that deficiency represents an enormous problem for developing economies; argues that achieving higher standards, rather than pursuing mere enrollment numbers, will be difficult and expensive, but unquestionably worthwhile.
lead_paragraph: Globally, more children than ever are attending school, but some experts say high-quality education has proved elusive. The solution will be expensive.

headline.print_headline: More in School, but Not Learning
headline.main: More in School, but Not Learning

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development
